headline: What to know about Jane Timken, the ex-Ohio GOP chair running for Senate
author: Orlando Mayorquin
sentences: Like much of the rest of the field, Timken is billing herself as the “Trump” candidate,though he gave his much anticipated endorsement to venture capitalist and author JD Vance just weeks before the primary election.
Timken has made the Republican-waged battle against school curriculums that teach the United States’ history of injustice a focal point of her campaign, decrying the “Left’s ‘woke’ education agenda."
Timken will face off against a list of candidates that includes Vance, businessman Mike Gibbons, former Ohio treasurer Josh Mandel and others in the Republican primary election on May 3.
Timken supports continuing construction on the wall at the U.S.-Mexico border that began under Trump, rejecting amnesty for undocumented immigrants and increasing deportations.
Timken is the former chair of the Ohio Republican Party, a position she held from 2017 until she resigned in February 2021 ahead of launching her campaign for Senate.
A former Ohio GOP chair who rose to power with the backing of former President Donald Trump now wants to represent the Buckeye State in the U.S. Senate.
